title: What kind of weapons did the Spanish conquistadors use? - Quora

response.answer_text: Swords, polearms of various types, bows, crossbows, arquebuses, bombards, and older siege engines. Mostly they used mobility; they had horses and horse-drawn transport, the locals did not. And they used armour; they had iron and steel mail and plate, the locals did not. And they used experience and tactics; they had seven hundred years worth of experience in fighting the Moors and kicking them off the Iberian peninsula; the Aztecs were used to crushing far weaker foes and taking prisoners for slaves and sacrifice, the Incas has no serious rivals and knew it. Against the Aztecs they had allies, lots of allies: all those weaker foes who had been hammered repeatedly for slaves and sacrifices and really, really, REALLY didn’t like that. Against the Incas they had the simple fact that the Incas couldn’t conceive of the thought that someone else might be better soldiers than they were. Oops. And they had religious zealots; seven hundred years of religious wars will do that.

Conquistador Clothing - Cabrillo National Monument (U.S. National Park Service) “Weapons: Every man had a lance and a sword 4 “arms of Castile” 3 crossbows 3 matchlock muskets 1 two handed sword 1 dagger 2 lances (Since these two were specifically noted, they presumably are the heavier impact type weapon not normally carried in the field in Nueva España.) “ “ Weapons: 49 swords 1 two handed sword 12 daggers 21 matchlock muskets 16 crossbows ”
